person.persName: Drury Hudson (Green County, Kentucky, police judge, merchant, and soldier)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, police judge, merchant, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth L. Hudson. Father of Helen Hudson and Fielding L. Hudson. Merchant in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Merchant in Green County in 1860. Employed John Woldridge as a laborer in Green County in 1860. Police judge in Green County in 1861. Served as a private in the 3rd Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A). Surrendered at Atlanta, Georgia, on May 10, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on May 28, 1865.
